questions.question: Q1. The aqueous solution of which of the following compounds is the best conductor of electric current?
Q2. Which of the following is not an example of an oxidizing agent?
Q3. Which of the following substances can act as both oxidising and reducing agent?

answers.d: by the movement of electrons from the cathode to anode

questions.question: Q5.  An electrochemical cell generally consists of a cathode and an anode. Which of the following statements is correct with respect to the cathode?

answers.c: Usually denoted by a negative sign
answers.d: Is usually made up of insulating material

questions.question: Q6. Which of the following is not a type of electrochemical cell?

answers.c: Usually denoted by a negative sign
answers.d: Is usually made up of insulating material

questions.question: Q7. Which of the following is not a generally used electrolyte in the salt bridges used to connect the two half-cells of an electrochemical cell?
Q8.The reductant may be defined as a substance, whose oxidation no of the atom?
Q9.The chemical NaOH which is used in the manufacture of soaps, detergents, papers etc. is prepared by the electric current in?
Q10. Which of the following is not a good conductor?
